properties.areaDesc: South Central Oregon Coast; Curry County Coast
properties.headline: Frost Advisory issued March 1 at 9:40PM PST until March 2 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Temperature between 33 and 36 degrees Fahrenheit in the
valleys of the advisory area is to likely to result in frost
formation.

* WHERE...Portions of the south central Oregon coast and Curry
County coast including the towns of Bandon, Coos Bay, North
Bend, Lakeside, Reedsport, Coquille, Myrtle Point, Powers, and
Langlois.

* WHEN...Through 9 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Frost could damage or kill sensitive outdoor
vegetation if such plants are left unprotected.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...You can protect frost sensitive plants by
bringing them inside or by covering them.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
A Frost Advisory means that frost is expected. Sensitive outdoor
plants may be damaged or killed if left uncovered.

NWSheadline: FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY
